website_summaries.verdict: Made of durable enamel over steel, this kettle features all the required perks. It's the ultimate kettle for those who want quality.
pros: Can be used on any type of stove top
cons: More expensive than many of its competitors

customer_reviews.title: Kettle has rust around rim
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the kettle in Dec 2018 and only used it to boil water for coffee. About a month ago, we noticed rust around the rim where the lid is attached. There is a 5 yr warranty listed and we have tried to call the listed number multiple times but are put on hold and after a while a message plays saying that we will get a call back and then it disconnects. We have never received a call back. In the future, we going to look for a stainless steel kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie P.

customer_reviews.title: A kettle that doesn't pour.  Nice (delicate) decoration though.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design and color. Too bad I didn't notice the designers had created the perfect little rocket nozzle of a pour spout. The pressure of a boiling load will not exit their hot funnel peacefully. A tea kettle that won't pour = next-to-useless. Also - chipped it in the sink on the first cleaning - before I ever used it. Yes I'm a klutz but it wasn't a hard knock either; just a little ding. So this one is a decoration/yard sale - brought my old chrome dome down for regular use again.
customer_reviews.author: masReader

customer_reviews.title: Already rusting at 7 months!
customer_reviews.text: Well, after 7 months this tea kettle is already rusting on the inside. This means that the enamel coating must have worn off. So we have to have been drinking the coating which can't be healthy. It's too bad it turned out to be of such low quality. Otherwise it is attractive and has nice features. But for more than 60 dollars I really expected much greater longevity. I've had much cheaper tea kettles last much longer. I won't be buying this brand again for any of their products.
customer_reviews.author: C. Koob

customer_reviews.title: Hot Handle!
customer_reviews.text: Kettle looks great, and the whistle would gradually get loud enough to get your attention without being grating. But I had a couple of issues with it as well: 1. Minor issue, but the cap over the spout was accidentally welded on at an angle, so it looked a little "off" 2. Would take several minutes for water to boil, even if not that much water in the kettle 3. The main problem is that the handle would get very hot! This is just an accident waiting to happen. Ended up returning it just for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes forever to boil water
customer_reviews.text: Looks pretty but it took 15+ minutes to boil water (2/3 full) on a high-powered gas burner. At that rate, I'd have to get up early to start making a cup of tea before work! Guess I'll stick with my previous kettle that boiled in under 7 minutes...
customer_reviews.author: wideopenseasTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Quality Kettle, But The Oyster Color Arrived as Flint
customer_reviews.text: The tea kettle is well-built. It does seem to be of quality, but the color advertised is misleading. I ordered Oyster, but Flint arrived. I searched online, and I've come across colors labeled as Oyster/Flint as a single color. I've attached photos to show the difference, as the color of the actual product is way lighter than advertised. For an $80 tea kettle, a more accurate image would've been appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Parts have melted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kettle about two months ago and it was working fine, until I noticed that the plastic around the spout was actually starting to MELT. I have only been using it to boil water in exactly the way one would expect to be able to use a kettle, and I have no idea how such a ridiculous design flaw could exist in a la creuset product. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: aeh

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I had this tea pot for less than 2 months and used it 4 times and the enamel is chipping off all over. For $80, I expect much higher quality from Le Creuset.
customer_reviews.author: Tecride

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at the quality a year later
customer_reviews.text: Loved this when I got it however washing it this evening, I noticed rust forming around the spout on the inside as well as the rim of the top where the lid sits. I'm super surprised that this is happening with this brand. I was under the impression that this would last longer than a year of sporadic use.
customer_reviews.author: Mindit_all

customer_reviews.title: Wow, open box total fail - adhesive bar code on bottom!
customer_reviews.text: Are you kidding me? I just received this beautiful kettle - and on the bottom, that's right, where the *ing kettle makes contact to a burner, is a giant barcode sticker. Oh, but no, it is not your oridinary sticker. It is INDUSTRIAL strength glue bound, I've been 10 minutes failing to peel it off - and with the residual glue, I'll have to apply some spirit to remove it and clean. Thank you Le Creuset, that was a total joy experience (not). The kettle is incredible looking, haven't cooked with it yet. Sure how the foul smell of the glue or the spirit doesn't spoil what could have been a delicious tea.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Fichter

customer_reviews.title: Love this kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my ceramic hob, and i'm excited to have a kettle that will go with me on any stove, hopefully for life! Pleasingly weighted, the lid is easily removed. It pours cleanly without any splatter. The whistle is loud I can hear it throughout my flat which means I never boil and re-boil the kettle - commonly did that with my electric. It sits out happily as a gorgeous feature of the kitchen. Enamel is perfect and no hard water build up (possibly yet, have had it two months, but following manufacturers instructions and haven't even had to wash it in soapy water yet). Very, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: clare

customer_reviews.title: Great tea pot
customer_reviews.text: This tea pot replaced a sad, rusty, awkward, broken tea pot that my SIL passed to us a decade ago. I'm drinking so much more tea now that water heats up more quickly. Clean up is easy. The whistle is fine. Very happy not to wrangle a broken spout lid anymore, this little flip up lid is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this Teakettle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Marine color. I have been using this for a month and half and it is fabulous! Love the color and this one does not have the fill line on the outside which I really like... it has a nice clean look. Heats up fast and I can hear the water boil before the whistle which is perfect for me because really, who wants to wait for their cup of tea. Handle moves for easy cleaning and lid is easy for me to pop off. I am very happy with this kettle. :)
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Love the way it looks, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks awesome! The whistle blew really loud! I was 3 floors up and I could hear it! I can never hear anything that far away in my townhome. My only complaint is that the handle gets s little hot. I have only cooked on it once, and I used it on the largest burner, so next time I will try a smaller burner and see what happens. This feels solid and I don't think it will break easily. 100% would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mowens

customer_reviews.title: Favorite whistling teakettle
customer_reviews.text: I love these teakettles. Because I use a French press to make coffee, i need a kettle to boil water on the stove; and because I tend to wander off and cruise the web while waiting for the water to heat, I need a loud whistle. The Le Creuset is sturdy, very pretty, and good & loud.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria H.Top Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: A pretty but difficult to use tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: While the tea kettle is attractive and well crafted, it is poorly designed and very difficult to use . The spout is obscured when trying to pour heated water if the tea kettle is filled more than half way. The result is that with even minimum tilt, water pours out of the kettle in an unseen direction ( not necessarily into the cup it was intended for) and in a difficult-to-control amount
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Would not expect with the name and reputation for the tea kettle to be such poor quality. Left on the burner too long for sure but I have done worse before. Paint started chipping off and looks terrible. I'm not talking about a little, I am talking a lot. Will not buy another
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jones

customer_reviews.title: Red "teapot"
customer_reviews.text: I love it - the color, the different shape, I just love it! Very sturdy and large enough to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: rednn

customer_reviews.title: Looks great on my new stove!
customer_reviews.text: I just remodeled my kitchen and the old kettle was looking pretty rough. This one is stunning and looks great just sitting on the stovetop. I imagine a long and cozy relationship with this kettle - bring on the tea.
customer_reviews.author: Quita E.

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: So Far So Good Very Attractive and Does it's Job! Boils water very quickly - I'M VERY HAPPY WITH THIS KETTLE BUT - DO NOT OVERFILL - FOLLOW DIRECTIONS!
customer_reviews.author: harriet forman, RN, EdD

customer_reviews.title: It's Le Creuset so what needs to be said?
customer_reviews.text: It's stylish enough that I don't mind it sitting on the stove all the time! May not be important to you but it is for me. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dell

customer_reviews.title: Stylish and functional tea kettle
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my daughter and she reported back that it is the best kettle she had ever owned, and she has had a number of them. The gray seems to be a hard-to-find color and it goes perfectly with her kitchen.,
customer_reviews.author: Lois Steem

customer_reviews.title: I really like the wider body on this type
customer_reviews.text: The wider body on this type of tea kettle makes it easier to pour and I think it heats up the water faster than my old one. It's well made too.
customer_reviews.author: NormB

customer_reviews.title: nice kettle, heats quickly, looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Seals tight, heats quickly..and somehow gets the water hotter than any other kettle I have ever used! And it goes well with the other Le creuset items in the kitchen. I let it sit open for a little bit before making my tea or else it is too hot.
customer_reviews.author: AB123

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality traditional kettle.
customer_reviews.text: Seems okay quality and works fine. Don't like that the handle gets hot but seems like any kettles are made this way. The color is really nice and makes a nice statement in my mostly white and gray kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Chris

customer_reviews.title: Now I know it's a defective product and I'm very surprised because I trusted Le Creuset to produce better quality.
customer_reviews.text: The enamel chipped on the outside, the lining of the kettle rusted and chipped into my water. I bought one in 2016 and the same thing happened. Somehow I blamed myself for it so I bought another one in 2017, same result. Now I know it's a defective product and I'm very surprised because I trusted Le Creuset to produce better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Warder

customer_reviews.title: Kettle of very poor design
customer_reviews.text: I have persevered with this kettle. As a tea drinking family, we make lots of tea. The design of this item means one cannot boil water since the spout is too narrow and the steam gathers on the whistle and drips down the spout and makes an awful mess. By the time one can pour the water without spillage, it has dropped in temperature defeating the purpose of a kettle. What is your response to this question, please?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hot handle
customer_reviews.text: Doggone it. I thought the handle one this thing was supposed to stay cool to the touch after boiling water. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: just another geek

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews before purchasing. This is a perfect kettle. The whistle blows loud and strong, and the water boils in about 7 minutes - about the same as my old electric kettle. The water pours perfectly into the tea pot or French press. The handle gets hot and you cannot lift it with your bare hand (hot pad, tea towel etc all work) - BUT this is not a criticism - what do you expect from a stove top kettle? I recommend this kettle and will likely be purchasing more for gifts at Christmas and weddings.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good tea kettle but the fit of the lid is a bit too tight.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great kettle. It works well on my induction stove. My wife likes the red color. I wish the whistle were louder and it would be easier to use if the lid didn't fit so tight.
customer_reviews.author: William Renfroe

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Simply beautiful! Love the design, looks great out on my stove. Works as expected. Like the loud whistle when I am upstairs.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: For the most this is a pretty good kettle
customer_reviews.text: For the most this is a pretty good kettle. The three star rating is for the metal rim around the top opening that helps seat the lid---cheaply made and is not firmly connected to the rest of the pot. It can be weird and let steam out by not properly sealing it. Otherwise it's a well-made product.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt BB

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE QUALITY! ENAMEL IS PEELING
customer_reviews.text: The quality is horrible. Less than 2 months and the enamel is chipping around the edge of the lid. Unacceptable!
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Received As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Received As Advertised - have used daily for multiple months and still holding up great
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Well it's short and stout compared to old tea kettle. Heats up much faster which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful design and easy to clean. Looks great on my stove.
customer_reviews.author: Leila

customer_reviews.title: Looks great in my kitchen which has red accent colors and is of good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Love the color bright red, loud whistle which was important to me since I have a hearing problem and I like that you can fold the handle down so it’s easier to fill . A real quality product so I guess that’s why it was more expensive than other kettles.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Q

customer_reviews.title: impossible to pour without dripping!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first negative review but this Teakettle is deserving of it. I cannot believe this made it through any type of testing whatsoever. The Teakettle leaks no matter how fast or slow you pour it. Face it, when a teakettle leaks it is 100% worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and functions
customer_reviews.text: It’s water extremely fast and looks attractive on the stove
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Great because of the different tones that it's gives off its very accurate for different teas temperatures
customer_reviews.author: michael w. connell

customer_reviews.title: Melts!
customer_reviews.text: This product melted on my stove after boiling water for tea for one minute! We don’t have anything out of the ordinary for a range top and the flame was a usual height for boiling water. When I went to pour my tea, the stopper was completely melted. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Tracey M.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Color was pretty, but the lid is hard to get off.
customer_reviews.author: AMK

customer_reviews.title: Great teaOt
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, sturdy teapot. Love the color too.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Best tea kettle on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful! The nicest tea kettle on the market! I will never purchase another tea kettle again. I discovered this kettle from my old roommate and when I moved out I had to get my own.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L Halbin

customer_reviews.title: This is our favorite Teapot!
customer_reviews.text: I love the loud whistle. You can clearly hear it from another room. I would recommend this teapot to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Teapot
customer_reviews.text: I love the bright color of this teapot. I also appreciate the whistling when the water is boiling as we can just set it and forget it until the water is ready.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Meets all expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Very durable. Fell from the top of my refrigerator to the floor and didn’t make a dent. Used to heat water for tea. Pouring spout worked accurately. Stylish.
customer_reviews.author: Adriaen Morse

customer_reviews.title: Size is perfect and the pot is very beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tea kettle! Easy to clean, the fat body is super cute! The red color is rich and attractive!
customer_reviews.author: GoingEast

customer_reviews.title: Le Creuset always pleases
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift and was most well received. Le Creuset products are worth the price...a welcome addition
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and practical
customer_reviews.text: I spent a little more for this tea kettle but I love the way it looks in my kitchen and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine T. Maynard

customer_reviews.title: great quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Less expensive that other LeCreuset Enamel-on-Steel tea pots. Beautiful design and typical Le Creuset quality. Only complaint is the whistle is more like a screech.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product at reasonable cost.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely kettle which I could only get in US in the colour I wanted. Didn't wait too long for delivery either. Thank you amazon.
customer_reviews.author: carole laverne-southwell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's physically beautiful to look at. It also heats really fast. Completely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C.

customer_reviews.title: I love this teapot
customer_reviews.text: I love this teapot. The shape is great. The handle never gets hot and the whistle works quite well. It is easy to fill up and easy to pour. Looks good on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Judy L.

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, works great and the handle does not get ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, works great and the handle does not get that hot. Glad we bought it!! Good quality for the price too. Well worth it
customer_reviews.author: Jillybean16

customer_reviews.title: Exquisite teapot
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful teapot, exquisitely made, super high quality. You get what you pay for here!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and design
customer_reviews.text: Have this kettle for a while now and it still looks like new. It's stylish and I love the color. It's easy to clean but remember don't put too much water in it. I only fill it half the way each time.
customer_reviews.author: Grace S

customer_reviews.title: Lovely
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a present for my mom. I was really excited when I got it to give her because it is just so pretty (like all creuset items). She is loving it too. Totally unnecessary because let's be honest, it boils water. But, as most tea kettles just live on the stove, it's nice to have such an attractive item if I'm going to look at it everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Caser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: exactly what we wanted for a really good price !
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Forget

customer_reviews.title: Dune is nice neutral color but beautiful as well
customer_reviews.text: Gift for daughter who says she loves it...Dune is nice neutral color but beautiful as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply fabulous!
customer_reviews.text: Quite simply, I love this kettle! It looks amazing, feels solid (but isn't too heavy) and you can boil water in it as well! There is simply nothing more comforting on a cold winter day than the sound of a whistling kettle on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: drips
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this kettle and the brand is good but... it drips a bit when pouring. For that reason I would recommend you try another shape. I'm keeping mine because I can't be bothered sending it back
customer_reviews.author: kim

customer_reviews.title: Drip?
customer_reviews.text: It does drip a bit when pouring tea, otherwise it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Beauty and function
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic item, you can really feel the quality and it looks beautiful too. Fast delivery considering I'm in the UK!
customer_reviews.author: Philippa C Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Zen TKettle
customer_reviews.text: This T Kettle is beautiful, very function-able and well made. It looks so good in the kitchen. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sonoma Cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The Best. Boils water very quickly. I use it multiple times a day. Color looks great. Good addition to the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rens

customer_reviews.title: STEAMING MAD lol
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is GARBAGE. do not be fooled by the otherwise reliable brand. this kettle cannot withstand heat. very regretful purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Divers

customer_reviews.title: Love whistling tea kettles
customer_reviews.text: Love whistling tea kettles! This purchase replaced one that was 15 years old and I expect the same (or more) years of service from the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Such great colors to choose from for this great tea kettle!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product now for about at month, and I just love it. It really is well-designed. It does not drip when pouring hot water. The lid fits quite securely, but is easy to remove. The handle does not get hot, and it swivels for ease of filling. It is not a problem to flip open the spout cover. It whistles perfectly. It's attractive on my cooktop. It was somewhat expensive, compared to other tea kettles, but I plan to use it for many years. I looked at LOTS of alternatives, and read all the other reviews, and chose this one. I'm glad I did, and I would recommend this one to anyone who wants the perfect tea kettle!
customer_reviews.author: Jill L. Ducatman

customer_reviews.title: Started to break after a year.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent kettle, itnhas taken care of me for almost a year, sometimes a few times a day. Sadly the rim where the lid fits onto the kettles body seems to be wearing loose. This isn't what the reputation of Le Creuset suggests, perhaps they made them hardier in the past. I'll continue to use this until the wear has gotten past the point of sensible, but I will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeous color, lovely shape. It was a little smaller than I expected - but has a nice, wide bottom so water boils very quickly. Mine does not drip like others have mentioned. UPDATE: I think people are having trouble with dripping because they are pouring out the water while it is still boiling. Any kettle will spit boiling hot water while the water is still boiling.
customer_reviews.author: KKinGA

customer_reviews.title: Dribbles like a toddler
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and color, but man, I just can’t get over how the spout dribbles! I’ve tried pouring slowly, quickly, at weird angles... nothing stops the boiling water from spilling down the outside of the spout. It’s not that hard to clean up a little puddle of water... but I also feel like I shouldn’t have to every single time I use it—especially at this price!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Like the shape, color (red) and size of the tea pot. No problem with the whistle as others have commented but the handle does get hot if over a large burner. My complaint is that there appears to be a small leak at the base of the spout causing a mineral buildup there. Had to use a vinegar solution to partially remove it. Went into a Creuset store and they were of no help at all. None of the points they brought up or suggestions they offered would account for the leak or a way to "prevent" it. Excessive amount of money for an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: RonGut

customer_reviews.title: Great Tea Kettle, Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: Great Tea Kettle. The folding handle makes it so easy to fill and use. Heats very quickly. Whistle is more than loud enough. The look is also very nice, different than typical Tea Kettles. As for the few people who complained about the Le Creuset Lable on the kettel, come on folks, it was a thin clear plastic type label that peeled off easily with a little patience. Anyway very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FON

customer_reviews.title: High-quality kitchen equipment
customer_reviews.text: The design of this kettle greatly enhances its ability to bring water to a rapid boil. It is both well-designed and well-constructed. It is also beautiful. Would buy it again and recommend its purchase to anyone wanting a quality piece of kitchen equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this teapot for a while now. The enamel has not cracked. This teapot heats up the water quickly. If you tip the teapot quickly then water will spurt out, however, if you tip the teapot slowly then the water pours out normally.
customer_reviews.author: rebeccaf734

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My wife has really enjoyed it, I was afraid to spend this much on a kettle after all the many bad reviews on leaking and rust but mine has been perfect. Pours perfectly into the cup with no drips, and not a single spot of rust after many months of use June 3, 2016 still no rust April 18, 2017 still no rust
customer_reviews.author: Harris

customer_reviews.title: Drips boiling hot water everywhere when pouring
customer_reviews.text: Chose this for the name and design, hoping to have it for the rest of our lives. Drips water from the spout all down the side no matter how you pour it or how much water is in it. Looks great and boils fast but you can tell once it's in your hands that the quality is just not there. Many review of the whistles either not working either or fading out over time, however we don't have that issue. The whistle assembly does look a little cockeyed though. You'd expect this from a $10 kettle, not a $60+ kettle. Returning asap, will unfortunately not get another Le Creuset kettle.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Alphabet

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and works well, but I torched it.  Not a fan of the black plastic parts.
customer_reviews.text: Kettles pretty much live on your stovetop, so we wanted one that looked nice. This product looks great, and performs very well. We had ours for about 2 years, and then one day I forgot to flip the whistle/cap down, got a phone call, and 20 minutes later all of the water boiled off, and eventually the black plastic parts at the spout melted off. We have another kettle that has a 'spring loaded' whistle/cap, so it always returns to the down position. I think that is the way to go. But as long as you don't forget to flip this cap down before you turn on the heat, this product does a good job and does look very good.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Looks great until the handle breaks
customer_reviews.text: Has same pros and cons as most Le Creuset kettles, though this one is especially modern looking. The thin handle can snap in half and there is no way to replace it, so that's where this one takes a hit (literally)
customer_reviews.author: Danpopa

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and functional
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this tea kettle for a short while, but I really enjoy using it. I was a bit wary because of the multiple reviews which complained about leaks and boiling water shooting out when pouring, but I read the directions and have had no problems. It clearly states to let it cool for 5 - 10 seconds and open the whistling mechanism. No problems!
customer_reviews.author: Myra Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Beauty and Function
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weight: solid in the way that lets you know you don't need to worry about burning out the bottom if you don't answer the whistle immediately. It's also just a beautiful design. The lines and balances are art, and I love seeing it in my kitchen. Its easy to fill at the tap, and pours without spilling.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hudson

customer_reviews.title: We love our kettle
customer_reviews.text: We love our kettle! Very nice looking, just leaks or splutters a bit when you pour. Seems sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Love the lines of this tea pot
customer_reviews.text: Love the lines of this tea pot, and the grey ombré color is great and will compliment my new kitchen. I have no issues with the spout, spillage or any of the other negatives I have read in reviews. Very happy with my purchase and plan to keep this for a long time.

product_meta.title: Le Creuset Enamel-on-Steel Zen Teakettle, 1-2/3-Quart, Cerise
product_meta.description:
Color:Cerise

LE CREUSET ENAMEL-ON-STEEL ZEN 1-2/3-QUART TEAKETTLE, CHERRY
WITH CLASSIC AND MODERN SHAPES, THERE'S A LE CREUSET KETTLE TO FIT INTO ANY KITCHEN DESIGN SCHEME. ALSO CONVENIENT TO BOIL WATER FOR OATMEAL OR FRENCH PRESS COFFEE, A LE CREUSET KETTLE IS AN EASY WAY TO ADD A SMALL DASH OF COLOR TO ANY KITCHEN.
FEATURES
 * Single-tone whistle alerts when water has reached a rolling boil
 * Generous base size for greater contact with heating element so water boils quickly
 * Convenient quick heating with superior heat distribution
 * Fixed whistle can be easily flipped open for pouring
 * Stainless steel handle brackets for secure handling
 * Heat-resistant ergonomic handle for safe pouring
 * Kettle capacity marked on the base for quick reference
 * Can be used on any heat source (gas, electric, ceramic, halogen, induction)

HEATING TIPS 
When filling the kettle with water, only fill water above the first layer of holes on the interior of the spout (see diagram on box for more information).

For efficient and safe boiling, always use burner a similar in size to the base of the kettle.

CLEANING AND CARE
Do not bang the teakettle down onto a stove's surface or work surface. Repeated banging may damage the exterior enamel.

Do not place the kettle on the heat source without having water in the kettle. Never leave a teakettle simmering for long periods on any heat source; it may boil dry, which can result in overheating and damage to the base and enamel.

Do not leave water standing in a kettle when it is not in use. A buildup of scale may occur and reduce efficiency.

Before pouring from your teakettle, remove it from the burner and ensure the handle is in the upright position.

Le Creuset proudly uses heat-resistant plastic on our handles and whistles.

Never place in the dishwasher.To clean, simply hand-wash the kettle with hot, soapy water and dry thoroughly. A gentle kettle de-scaler may be used periodically if required. 



AMAZON.COM
Slow down and savor the serenity of the Zen tea kettle during a busy day. Shaped like an inverted bowl, the low, broad-based kettle features a gracefully arched Asian-style handle that locks in an upright position, or releases for compact storage. A round heat-resistant knob adorns the lid. Flip back the spout cover to stop the whistling and pour. The Zen holds approximately 50 ounces of water, more than enough to brew four cups of tea. 

 Le Creuset makes the Zen kettle of enameled steel in a choice of many bright, modern colors to match any kitchen. A stainless steel band on the lid and around the rim opening helps prevent chipping. Best of all, the tea kettle is suitable for any type of stovetop burner, so you can give one as a gift without having to know your recipient's stove type. Clean by hand or in the dishwasher when necessary. --Ann Bieri
